 CompoundItem ()

Detailed Description

A compound-item may contain one ore more abstract editor-items. The editor-document is responsible for the administration of the compound-items and takes care of merging and deleting inserted and modified compound-items. Therefor the creating of a compound-item may not be done by the constructor, but by CompoundItem::CreateInstance, which is provided by each derived class. Note that the compound-item may store the items in an optimized format (e. g. character-items may be stored as WString-object instead of a vector of character-items), hence methods for getting the content of a compound-item must be defined in the derived classes.
See also:
AtomItem

Member Function Documentation

void CompoundItem::Clear (   )  [virtual]
 

Removes and deletes all continued items and clears the contained data.

Reimplemented in GeneralCompoundItem, ParagraphCompoundItem, and TextCompoundItem.

CompoundItem * CompoundItem::Clone (   )  const [virtual]
 

Makes a clone of the compound item. As soon as the cloned compound item is inserted into an editor document it is obtained by the editor document and hence may not be modified or accessed outside the scope of the editor document anymore. If the cloned compound item is not inserted to an editor document, it must be deleted manually if not needed anymore.

Returns:
Pointer to the cloned compound item. 0 is returned if the cloning was not successful. Per default 0 is returned; it is recommended that derived classes implement the method Clone, but it is no requirement.

Reimplemented in GeneralCompoundItem, ParagraphCompoundItem, RichTextCompoundItem, and TextCompoundItem.

virtual INT CompoundItem::GetItemCount (   )  const [pure virtual]

INT  index = -1
)  [virtual]
 

Inserts the Item item before the item with the index index.

Returns:
TRUE, if inserting is supported and successful. Per default FALSE is returned for the implementation of the class CompoundItem.

BOOLEAN CompoundItem::Merge (  const CompoundItem &  compound_item  )  [virtual]
 

Merges the compound item with another compound item by appending the other compound item to itself.

Parameters:
compound_item compound item, which should be appended at the end of this compound item.
Returns:
TRUE, if the merge has been sucessful. FALSE is returned, when merging generally is not supported or the type of the compound item is not supported for the merge-process. Per default FALSE is returned for the implementation of the class CompoundItem.

Reimplemented in GeneralCompoundItem, RichTextCompoundItem, and TextCompoundItem.

BOOLEAN CompoundItem::Split (  INT  index,
CompoundItem **  compound_item
)  [virtual]
 

Splits the compound item in two parts. The second compound item will contain at least one Item, otherwise FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
index Index of Item, where the split should occur. The Item which matches to the index will be part of the second compound item.
compound_item Output parameter. Points to the second compound item.
Returns:
TRUE, if splitting is allowed. FALSE is also returned when the index is zero or indicates the last Item of the compound item. Per default FALSE is returned for the implementation of the class CompoundItem.

Reimplemented in GeneralCompoundItem, ParagraphCompoundItem, RichTextCompoundItem, and TextCompoundItem.

virtual INT CompoundItem::WrapLine (  INT  index,
XYDIM  width,
WrapPolicy  wrap_policy = EditorDocument::WhitespaceWrap
)  const [pure virtual]
 

Wraps a line of a compound item corresponding to the wrap policy and returns the number of items which may get drawn.

Parameters:
index Start index of the item, where the wrapping should be started.
width Available width in pixels, where the items should be wrapped into.
wrap_policy The wrapping policy describes how the wrapping inside the available width is done (
See also:
EditorDocument::WrapPolicy)

Implemented in GeneralCompoundItem, ParagraphCompoundItem, ParagraphMarker, DateCompoundItem, IpAddrCompoundItem, TextCompoundItem, and TimeCompoundItem.
